emuInput.TitMainTitle: Motorcycle police officers escorting motorcade out of shopping center parking lot for demonstration, Frankstown Avenue and Gerritt Street
emuInput.CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 28, 1965, pg. 4 reads: "Rights Motorcade Starts - Leaving the shopping center parking lot, near the Shiloh Community Baptist Church, Frankstown Ave. at Gerritt St., Monday, is the 45-car motorcade which was escorted by numerous motorcycle patrolmen, the Interracial Squad, and other police vehicles. Approximately 175 people took part in the demonstration the first day and less than half that number on Tuesday. - Harris Photo."
